quiz.question: In England, judges developed 'common law' by a process of tradition and precedence that is, following previous decisions
quiz.label: True
False

quiz.question:
The period after the Norman Conquest up until about 1485 is called
(Choose any 2 answers)
quiz.label: The Age of Discovery
The Middle Ages
The Medieval period
The Renaissance
Late Antiquity

quiz.question: Everyone in the UK with a TV, computer or other medium which can be used for watching TV must have a ______
quiz.label: television licence
copyright licence
driving licence
personal licence

quiz.question:
New citizens ______ loyalty to the Queen as part of the citizenship ceremony
(Choose any 2 answers)
quiz.label: send
swear
affirm
sign

quiz.question:
People in the UK have to pay tax on their income, which includes:
(Choose any 3 answers)
quiz.label: All ISAs and Savings Certificates
Wages from paid employment
Taxable benefits
Attendance Allowance
Pensions
Pension Credit

quiz.question: 2 seconds silence is observed on the Remembrance Day
quiz.label: True
False It should be 2 minutes

quiz.question: The Prime Minister has control over many important public appointments
quiz.label: True
False

quiz.question: Drivers can use their driving licence until they are ______ years old
In the 20th century, Sir Edwin Lutyens designed ______ to be the seat of government in India
quiz.label: Mumbai
New Delhi
Bangalore
Kolkata

quiz.question: The Council of Europe has no power to make laws
quiz.label: True
False

quiz.question: The European Union law is an important source of law in Britain
quiz.label: True
False

quiz.question: What is the role of shadow cabinet?
quiz.label: Ask the members to join their party
Challenge the government and put forward alternative policies
Opening and closing of Parliament are some ceremonial duties

quiz.question: It is ______ to carry a weapon of any kind, even if it is for self-defence
quiz.label: your responsibility
your right
a criminal offence

quiz.question: St Andrew is the Patron Saint of ______
quiz.label: Scotland
Wales
England
Northern Ireland

quiz.question: If you are self-employed, you need to pay your own tax through a system called
quiz.label: Self-checkout
Self-assessment
Trade Union
National Insurance contribution

quiz.question: The UK is historically a ______ country
quiz.label: Jewish
Christian
Hindu
Muslims

quiz.question: The most serious cases in Scotland, such as murder, are heard at a ______ with a judge and jury
quiz.label: Crown Court
Magistrates' Court
High Court

quiz.question: What is the origin of Parliament?
quiz.label: The Church's system of governance
The King's council of advisers
The Knights' round table
The Noblemen's council of governance

quiz.question: What is Hansard?
quiz.label: The Prime Minister's progress report
Parliament's official reports
Report about the Queen

quiz.question: What is the Church of England formally known as?
quiz.label: The Methodist Church
The Anglican Church
The Baptist Church

quiz.question: The Magna Carta protected the rights of the nobility and restricted the king's power to collect taxes or to make or change laws
quiz.label: True
False

quiz.question: The Emperor ______ built a wall in the north of England to keep out the Picts (ancestors of the Scottish people)
quiz.label: Antoninus
Hadrian
Marcus Aurelius
Verus

quiz.question:
Examples of civil laws are
(Choose any 3 answers)
quiz.label: Carrying a weapon or drugs
Unfair dismissal or discrimination in the workplace
Murder, racial crime
Theft and assault
Disputes between landlords and tenants
Faulty consumer goods or services

quiz.question: Who does make a speech which summarises the government's policies for the year ahead?
quiz.label: The Queen's husband
The Queen's oldest son
The Prime Minister
The Queen
